intro: Crenulluma rauhii, commonly known as the Florida flameflower, is a strikingly beautiful flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its vibrant, tubular red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has a woody stem and is typically found in moist, well-drained soils in wetlands or along waterways. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly wavy margin. Crenulluma rauhii is a valuable addition to native gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
